critique: This document is an executive order transferring control of San Clemente Island from the Department of Commerce to the Department of the Navy. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt, immigration approach, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, and social inclusion as the document pertains to a specific transfer of land for naval purposes. The order does not seem to expand executive power significantly, as it is based on existing legislation and includes a clause allowing revocation by the President or Congress. It also appears to shift control from one federal department to another, indicating a strong federal control.
